comments.body: One more reason to not fill any personal document forms for any thing related to Cryptocurrencies.  It is not about what can happen NOW.  Think about the future.  What can go wrong if the wrong people become leaders and write law.This is really concerning to me.  Some body said here it is not hard to exchange Bitcoin for Fiat privately.  It is not hard but there is a thing you forget.If this kind of Surveillance ends up with confiscation from mere SUSPICION then it will be hard to avoid a suspicion from them.  They can suspect you of hiding information from them by only looking at your browsing history the provider gives them.  You looked up the Goods and Trading boards of Bitcoin Talk often so you are suspicious.  Something like that.What if they suspect you of owning Bitcoin and some how connect the dots.  Say you used Tor at all times but got drunk once and forgot about it.  Or were using Tor and accidentally logged into a personal account somewhere.  You will be screwed.  I presume there will be very rough punishments for hiding.How private can you be really.  I am trying my best and even I know there are ways they can connect the dots to find me.  But I am still not important to them yet and what can I do after all.  I do the best I can.  Once they come for those like me I know the world will be in hell already.  When they go after people who simply want to mind their own business it is very bad.
